intro: Excoecaria antsingyensis, commonly known as the Madagascar croton, is a tropical shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and striking, brightly colored flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
